reviews.title: PROSTITUTION & DRUG - Rents hourly rooms to local prostitutes and drug
reviews.text: Late at night they rent rooms by the hour to PROSTITUTES and DRUG users. In the space of 30 minutes I saw them rent 3 hourly rooms to seedy men and their female companions. Then a strung out looking person came stumbling out.

Upon check-in I thought I had found the ideal NYC hotel. 3 blocks from the train to nyc. It's not Holiday Inn, but looked well kept. Even had security door going into rooms and a security guard at night. During the morning and day you see lots of families checking in and going to NYC.
reviews.title: All-Around Good Stay

reviews.text: BUT... when around 1 am when i went out into the lobby to read a NYC guide and outline the next day's trip, I found a stream of prosititutes and and seedy people coming in, knowing that they could rent a room for a couple hours. One thug looking guy started getting loud and mouthy, and told the clerk that they couldnt make him do anything. Five minutes later he is striding in with two girls on his arms, with the secure door being openned by the security guard.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: In the morning I asked the manager if this was normal, and she winced a bit and said "yes it is."
reviews.title: Just what we wanted...
Great deal!
reviews.text: This was a fine place to stay for a few nights while I was doing research in NY City. The PATH station is within comfortable walking distance, and I felt safe during the evenings when I returned. I had a room overlooking the Holland Tunnel entrance, but I never heard any traffic noise (I did have the air conditioner on, though). No problems with check in or check out. Morning breakfasts had great donuts and plenty of them. Room was clean and neat, and the staff was polite. For the caffeine junkies, there is a Starbucks on the other side of the PATH station and a lovely harbor with boats. Since it was nice weather, there were lots of people out with dogs or rollerblading. There is an Italian restaurant on the way home that is fine (Bercini's?), with the warm, crusty rolls the best part. (I know -- most people will eat in NYC, but sometimes that just isn't possible.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at MANY high end hotels and this one, by far, was the most unique! We loved the decor, in that it kept with the originality of the hotel. When we checked in, they were pretty full so we ended up renting the Penthouse Suite. It was amazing, king size bed to die for and it's own private deck with a hot tub (NOT a whirlpool tub). The hotel has beautiful historic pictures and actual keys for the doors (not key cards lol). We will stay at the Holland every time we travel anywhere near Alpine!
reviews.title: Best Stay Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never been treated any nicer and better in my life.Joe and Georgia and staff really know how to treat people.The rooms are beautiful ,the lobby is hugh, and has true western flavor.Breakfast was great with an outdoor atrium,also opening a new restaurant.This town is in the TEXAS ALPS simply beautiful. Thanks for the memory JIM,SUE,JIMMY and AMBER,SEE YA AGAIN!
reviews.title: THIS PLACE IS ACES AND AFFORDIBLE

reviews.text: Three couples on bike ride to west Texas spent 3 nights at Holland Hotel. We all enjoyed our stay and the excellent hospitality of the staff. Beautiful old hotel. Breakfast was soon good! Their new bar & grill should be open soon. We will be back!
reviews.title: You will not be disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Holland for two nights as part of a journey thru the region. The penthouse unit was a little pricey, but well worth it. You have to walk up to the top floor, but have a spacious room, a small kitchen area with microwave and sink, and an awesome outdoor space with a good view of the mountains, the stars and a large hot tub for two. The staff at the Holland were enthusiastic and friendly, and the decor is vintage. The only possible drawback for some might be the trains going through. We don't mind the sound, but it was loud. The hotel provides ear plugs anyway in the room. If you stay there, be sure to travel up to Marfa to see the "mystery lights." An engaging community experience with a twist of mystery thrown in. We'll definitely be back to the Holland.
reviews.title: Penthouse pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at The Holland! Everything was very comfortable, warm and welcoming. We enjoyed the complimentary drink as well as breakfast! We can't wait to return! Definitely stay in the Penthouse!!
reviews.title: Loved The Holland!

reviews.text: We just returned from a family vacation to NYC. Found out about this hotel through trip advisor, and I am so glad we did. This hotel is very clean and the staff was wonderful from the moment we walked in the door until we checked out. I read reviews about rooms being rented out hourly, we never saw any of this and some nights it was 11p.m. when we got in. Not to say it does not go on but if it does it is very late and we never felt unsafe. This hotel is right outside the Holland tunnel and as other reviews have reported a short walk to the PATH. This hotel worked very well for us and if you go over by the River on the walkway you get an awesome view of the NYC skyline (this is by the Hyatt). Thanks to everyone who posted a review here, it helped so much in planning this trip. We would stay here again!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay to visit NYC

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel with my family just a tad earlier than the normal check-in time and the front desk staff happily accommodated my request for an early check-in (I have four small children, all of whom were tired and needed a place to nap.) The accommodations were WONDERFUL! We were on the tunnel side of the hotel and were surprised that we heard no noise from the traffic. It was an easy walk from the hotel to the Path train station. The next morning we had the complimentary continental breakfast, which was included in the price of the hotel. The breakfast was lovely with fresh baked goods and fruits, and the quantity was more than plentiful. I asked the clerk on duty if I could extend my check-out until 1:00PM and she said that it was fine. We went to visit Ellis Island and see the Statue of Liberty. Upon returning to the hotel, we realized that not only were we exhausted, but we all really needed to freshen up before heading home. I inquired at the front desk and they told me that day use rooms were available. Since our flight was for later on that evening, the extra four hours was perfect for me and my family. This is a great place for families to stay if you want to tour New York City, but don't want to stay in the NYC. I would tell everyone about this hotel; it is the perfect place to stay!
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel For Family Siteseeing in NYC!

reviews.text: Visited this hotel since my family needed a place to stay near NYC while relatives from out of state came to visit. We planned to show them New york City for a weekend and then the Jersey Shore and the Casinos.
reviews.title: Great stop over to NYC

reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for our weekend stay. Just outside New York and near the path train. Shopping and restaurants nearby and the price was very reasonable. The breakfast was great and the staff was terrific. They even helped us set up a NYC tour with a local tour company.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT

reviews.text: This hotel treated my family very well and we would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Hotel for NYC Visits

likes.disliked: — fluctuating water temp in shower; difficulty of getting into it due to tunnel traffic

reviews.text: We stayed at this motel from July 31-August 8, 2007.
reviews.title: A VERY good deal!

likes.liked: — It was clean, well-priced and close to everything

reviews.text: This was the second time we have stayed there, the last being during Summer, 2005.
reviews.title: Recommendation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a terrific place, VERY good value and it has a courteous and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: We booked our room by calling the motel directly and saved a LOT of money by presenting our CAA (Canadian Automobile Assoc.) card. We ended up paying only about $770.00 CDN for 8 nights!
reviews.title: Just perfect

likes.liked: — The proximity of New York City and the security
likes.disliked: — the dark walls in the room

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights with two small children. Everything was fine: Clean room, exeptable rate, simple breakfast (for german standards) and a friendly staff. No complaints, so far!
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret

likes.liked: — Right outside of New York City

reviews.text: Holland Motor Lodge is the optimal hotel for anyone who is on a tight budget. Most of the features of this hotel have been mentioned before. I mention only points not covered before (or at least not read by me).
reviews.title: well worth the price

reviews.text: We (three families) stayed there this September at three different rooms. Two at the upper lever looking toward the highway with very good view of Empire State Building, especially at night. The last group stayed with window facing the parking lot. This room had some very harsh noise produced every morning at around five am when the trucks for garbage disposal set into work. This usually took a few minutes but was very irritating. Sometimes the maids began vacuum cleaning at around 8:30 in the morning which was not quite peaceful for guests sleeping later than that time. The walls are generally very thin and when in the corridor you could hear TV sound and arguments going on in the room.
reviews.title: Very nice, and quiet too!

reviews.text: The breakfast was a heaven for those who love pastries. In addition there was tea, coffee, oatmeal (powder), 2-3 types of fruit (at least bananas and apple), and orange juice. Considering the rate we paid it was plenty.
reviews.title: Perfect for the budget traveller.

likes.liked: — Clean, simple and great value for money.
likes.disliked: — No real dislikes - a bit off the beaten track.

reviews.text: Taking the Path proved easier and more convenient than I imagined. Its schedule seemed a little bit confusing at first but it is quite efficient. It is very cool to sit in the front car. We, in Europe, never get to see the tracks. The air condition was mostly working in the cars, except once which was quite annoying.
reviews.title: Great location for 4 people, especially if driving to NYC
Great Value Motel
reviews.text: The most irritating problem was insects in one of the rooms which led to severe itching of the persons living in that room. When we spoke to the manager he apologized and then paid back for two of the nights (we were staying eight nights). He also paid for the doctor's fee and medications. He also had people help with changing the room and had the room sprayed with insecticides.

reviews.title: Century Bar and Grill
reviews.text: We did not stay here but came in from Fort Davis for drinks and dinner. The bar was hopping with locals and visitors. The service was excellent and the wine list was good. Dinner was fantastic with perfectly grilled salmon on whipped parsnips. The dish had a slight Indian flavor that was perfect. Our waitress was pleasant and efficient. We really enjoyed the West Texas hospitality.
The Holland has been renovated and now there is a great restaurant and full bar! Our room was a junior suite with a jacuzzi tub.. We did not have time to break that in .. But what a bonus.
reviews.title: Amazing and dog friendly!

reviews.text: They are dog friendly and are so reasonable with the pet deposit.. Only $30.00 with $10.00 of that going to the local Humane Society! What a great idea for all pet friendly hotels. Pass that idea on....
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Alpine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is amazing also... And one of the owners was gracious enough to come to our table at dinner to thank us for being there. Very appreciated. We loved the whole experience. One tiny weenie flaw would be a few stains on the hallway carpet ... But really, who cares when you are in Alpine at The Holland!! Just chill and listen to the trains go by and look up at those stars.....
reviews.title: Breakfast guests only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Holland Hotel is a nice hotel and better than the hotel chains in Alpine. They just opened up a bar and restaurant
reviews.title: Second visit as charming as the first

reviews.text: We loved our visit! We stayed one night in the "Penthouse" with a jacuzzi and then the last night in a Junior Suite room. Both rooms were wonderful! The hotel also gave us breakfast vouchers for the Bread & Breakfast cafe on the next block and it was great to sit, eat & talk to locals. We we're within walking distance to the Riata Restaurant and the only movie theatre within 2 hours of anywhere! We stayed during the Labor Day weekend and had loads of activities to participate (Balloonfest, Marfa Lights Fest, McDonald Observatory Star Party, Solar Viewing, and tour, farmers market, Fort Davis exploration, sightseeing). We absolutely loved our stay and will definitely return some day!
reviews.title: We will be back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Groupon brought us to the Holland Hotel. Our assigned room wasn't ready, so they moved us to a Jr. Suite. Lots of room and a jacuzzi tub. Our first night was rough as we weren't on top of the remote that controlled the room temperature - also the noise from passing trains kept us from getting a good night's sleep. The tub has a sloping bottom - not the easiest to use for standing to take a shower. We discussed our concerns with those at the front desk the next morning. Have to say that they couldn't have been nicer. We moved to a room with a king bed and a regular tub. Also we were able to keep the room temperature ideal as the remote was much better. Night 2 was perfect !!! We loved the hotel and would recommend it. Considering its age, it is well maintained. The new bar and pub which should open within a month or so will be a great addition. Another plus are the iced tea, coffee and delicious lemonade that are always available. Actually two nights were not enough, there are more things to see and do on another trip.
reviews.title: Would Return

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Loft No. 1 at the Alpine Guest Lofts the first two weeks of July, 2012. We are repeat visitors. Loft No. 1 is a well-appointed, large one bedroom apartment with fully furnished kitchen. The location is excellent as the building is situated behind the Holland Hotel, near to shops, restaurants, and entertainment. The Lofts are managed by the same folks who staff the Holland Hotel and the Maverick Inn, which means extra amenities are available to guests. Snacks, coffee, tea, etc. are in the room and replenished as needed. The Lofts have a “secret” courtyard that is a great place to enjoy an aperitif before dinner. We will be back.
reviews.title: Loft 1 - Alpine Guest Lofts
WONDERFUL STAY but, don't get "The Guest Quarters"
reviews.text: When we first arrived after landing in Midland Texas airport and drove through what I thought was going to make me cry---we saw the the desert suddenly give way to mountains and pretty green vistas. Alpin was very quaint. The Holland was having the resturant renovated but, aside from that Laura Bush was speaking there that day and we were pretty much "locked out" of the bar and what later turned out to be a beautiful lobby and patio. Everyone was friendly and they tried to make us comfortable right away however.....the guy man with wild colored glasses was VERY EXCITED to show us to the "Guest Quarters" let me warn you......these were nothing but, run down apartments with ALLEY way entry to the beautiful and ACTUAL Holland Hotel.

Naturally --I balked--no way I was staying in those dumpy "renovated" "quarters" the manager was very kind--they were "sold out" and we knew they were--we were with a rather large group that came to the area to harvest grapes. SURELY they knew I would not have stayed in "The Quarters" after we paid for The Holland Hotel.
reviews.title: best mini vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless they changed out all of the furnishings in two days, I saw nothing that resembled Ikea in Loft 2 (as mentioned in the post below). We checked out on July 30 after staying 4 nights in Loft 2 during Viva Big Bend 2012. I think there's some confusion with the "Guest Quarters" building next to the Lofts. The Guest Quarters is all Ikea. The Lofts are anti-Ikea! We stay at the Holland "frequently" (considering it's 510 driving miles from our home!) and it is an excellent hotel. We never stay anywhere else when we're in Alpine (although we do try to work in a night at the Gage in Marathon every now and then, mainly for their great swimming pool!)
reviews.title: Stayed in Loft 2 for Viva Big Bend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Holland Hotel for 4 nights while attending the Viva Big Bend Music Festival. The Holland served as the headquarters for this event and was a vibrant place the whole weekend. The staff at the hotel were very upbeat all weekend and were attentive to all of our needs! We have stayed at the Holland several times and have been more than satisfied with the rooms as we're fond of historic hotels. The beds are very comfortable and the location in town can't be beat. The Holland is preparing to open a restaurant on the premises and we are eager to try it out on our next visit. If you're looking to stay in a restored historic landmark then the Holland Hotel should be at the top of your list when visiting Alpine! Finally, if you are a music fan check out Viva Big Bend next summer....you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Viva Big Bend at the Holland Hotel

reviews.text: Walking into the lobby of the Holland Hotel was shear appreciation for the wonderful restoration that has taken place. Having grown up in Alpine, I have seen some of the changes over the years and this time, the Holland Hotel welcomes you with it's original beauty and feel. What a treat! Save the stays at the newer hotels in town for when you have no other choice. Choose the Holland when in Alpine, you will not be sorry. You will have more to share when you get home and talk about your trip. History galore at every turn. You will not be giving up anything in the way of comforts and services. The staff was totally service oriented, professional but miles away from stuffiness! Cool little bar tucked into the lobby so plenty of room to spread out and check it all out! New restaurant being added and opening soon. Please support this great hotel!
reviews.title: Historic Holland Hotel was a Trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Alpine as a stop-off on the Sunset Limited train, primarily to visit Big Bend, but in the end our short stay in the town ended up being a highlight of the trip.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in a great little town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located right across the street from the station, which is very convenient. When we arrived, there was no sign of our rental car, so the person on reception kindly called the company, who duly arrived and parked our car in the station car-park - again, very convenient free parking, right across the street from the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful rooms
